{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the provided documents, several studies have shown that non-HDL cholesterol is a strong and independent predictor of cardiovascular events, including major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE) and all-cause death, in patients after acute myocardial infarction (AMI). In contrast, LDL cholesterol has shown mixed results in predicting these outcomes. Therefore, it can be concluded that non-HDL cholesterol is a better predictor of long-term outcome in patients after acute myocardial infarction compared to LDL cholesterol.", "answer_choice": "A"}
